intro: Odontostemma reductum, commonly known as the small-flowered stork's-bill, is a member of the family Geraniaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its seeds are enclosed in a distinctive, three-lobed capsule that splits open when mature. Odontostemma reductum is native to parts of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
